ai.summary: A demanding 27.2 km circular hike near East Wretham, weaving through Thetford Forest and surrounding heathland. The trail combines long forest tracks with open sections, requiring good fitness and navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including gravel forest tracks, dirt paths, grassy stretches and open heath. Expect muddy patches after rain, exposed roots, and gradual elevation changes; some sections may require careful route-finding through woodland and heath.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a full-day hike (roughly 6–9 hours). Carry a detailed map and compass or a reliable GPS, and know how to use them. Check weather and daylight hours; in winter the route can be exposed and very muddy. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers. Bring ample water and high-energy food, plus a small first aid kit and a whistle. Tell someone your planned route and expected return time. Be mindful of other forest users and potential cyclists; navigation aids are helpful in remote sections. If visibility is poor or conditions worsen, consider turning back or choosing a shorter route.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) for better weather and daylight; winter hikes are possible but can be very muddy, cold, and exposed.

seo.title: East Wretham Circular Walk – 27.2 km Hard Hike in Thetford Forest, UK
seo.meta_description: Take on the East Wretham Circular Walk, a challenging 27.2 km loop through Thetford Forest in Norfolk, UK. Practical tips, gear suggestions, safety notes, and best seasons.
seo.h1: East Wretham Circular Walk – 27.2 km Hard Hike
